headline: The Best Ever Chicken Nuggets
description: These fried chicken nuggets are coated in a mixture of flour, garlic salt, and black pepper, then fried until brown and crisp for a great party snack.

video.name: How to Make the Best Chicken Nuggets

name: The Best Ever Chicken Nuggets
recipeIngredient: 8 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into small chunks

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 inch oil in a large skillet or saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Stir together flour, garlic salt, and pepper in a bowl. Dip chicken pieces into beaten eggs, then press each piece into flour mixture to coat well; shake off excess flour. Place coated chicken pieces onto a plate.
Working in batches, fry chicken in hot oil until golden brown and no longer pink in the center. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: This came out real good and with a good taste..i will make again
Great recipe. Just like Chick-Fil-A but a lot less hate!
Amazingly easy and delicious.
Super good! I think the recipe needed too much though, I made 20 nuggets with materials of six.
I actually have not made this dish yet, but just from looking at the ingredients and how they go together, I can tell this is going to taste really good. Cant wait!

Wife likes it. I liked it. Did not have garlic salt, but mixed garlic granules and salt and it was just right. Not salty at all. Will make it again during family gathering. It’s good with ranch dressing for dipping.
I saw the measurement for pepper, & said whoa! I cut it down to 1 Tablespoon, but grandkids and adults said “way too much pepper “! Won’t deviate from my tried and true recipe again!
This is horrible. To salty, bland and greasy. Will not be making this again
Mine were neither too salty or sticky! Just right. crispy. I actually added a bit more salt. Turned out well even without an oil thermometer!

This recipe was simple and very good. Would be even better kicked up a notch.
No complaints, which means my fussy eaters liked it.
Our favorite nuggets!!! We are a savory family, so if you like nuggets with a ton of flavor, these are for you. We like to deep fry them at 375 F for 4 minutes.
My family loves this recipe.
Bread it twice!

I made this tonight and kids loved it. Just like everyone else mentioned about to much flour or not enough or too much salt I adjusted both and they were a hit. I will be adding this to our favorites list.
Best and easiest recipe for nuggets. Grandkids devoured them. Made one change, used self rising flour. Also put chicken in the refrigerator while oil was heating up. Will definitely make again.

I'll definitely be making this recipe again!

I just made it this night, and believe it really turned out amazing...personally I think it could've used less garlic salt, but I didn't mind it I thought it tasted great!

The only bummer is that I accidentally burnt my hand in the cooking oil....I will have too add a picture next time I make them because they looked just as great as they tasted
Very good, definitely a keeper!

First time making it was very bland. I didn’t understand the reviews about too much flour, now I do. Second time, 2c flour, 4 tbsp black pepper, 4 tbsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 tbsp cyan. Seems like a crazy amount of spice but more is better. They were really good this time. Next, maybe more cyan and something else..
4174.7 mg sodium REALLY??? That is insanely high so I opted to use garlic powder instead and only 3 TBS . Tasted much better and was way lower on the sodium level
Definitely use only two cups of flour. Used less garlic salt -only 3 tbsp. Only one tbsp black pepper. And did the flour-egg-flour dip method and turned out ah-freaking-mazing!!!!
Really good but not the best ever.
4 cups of flour is an incredible waste. I used 2 lbs of chicken because the recipe is vague, I had nearly 2 cups of flour left over. Same with eggs. 3 was too many.

Unfortunately, I followed so many of the suggestions to reduce the salt and was disappointed with the results. I will make again exactly per the directions and try again. I just felt like these were a little bland and lacking in flavor.
I actually used this to make chicken tenders instead of nuggets and it's now the only way I will eat them. Amazing!!

I made the recipe as it was written. Very good. The family enjoyed it. I might add a little more pepper to the flour next time I make it, but it is a definite keeper. I have to add that the chicken was moist and tender.

Pretty good. I’m going to cut back one of the tablespoons of garlic salt as the end result was too salty. The recipe (flour and egg mixture) can handle 5 chicken breasts easy and I’d bet it could handle 6.
I made these. Very good. Someone said they are less salty than Chic-Fil-a. That's because their chicken nuggets are loaded with MSG. Not good. Check out their ingredients.

I just don't think these are good at all. I HATE frying in oil, it just defies the idea of healthy eating. Plus, these came out unexpectedly greasy, and sticky with flour that never crusted up. BAKED tenders are the best way I've ever found. Into the oven to cook, no standing around frying in heavy oil. I much prefer to use panko crumbs to coat the pieces after I dip them in an egg wash that uses mayo and flour mixed together rather than as a separate step in the breading mixture. There are much better ways to make tenders that actually hold the crispy, crunchy texture without using oil. I won't ever make these again.
My kids said these were the best ever. I added a bit of Weber Kick’n Chicken seasoning. Easy and delicious.

I made these for my 6 year old for his birthday dinner during covid-19 because he loves chicken nuggets and our local McDonald's was closed! He devoured these and asked for seconds!! They were delicious! I tweaked the recipe a little using bread crumbs and onion powder like some others suggested, but this is definitely going to be on our family menu now!!
I made these for my grandsons, using 2 chicken breasts. These were really good, and my husband and I enjoyed them too.
Awesome! My 5 year old daughter and made this together. Yummy fast and easy!

Use less salt and these are a winner here’s a tip: with the flour mixture into two bowls. then dip the chicken in first flour bowl then egg and second flour bowl. Also, use tongs! This will keep the flour from getting sticky and the whole process is much less messy.
turned out really good, used half the flour, black pepper, and garlic salt though
It was okay and I liked it. The recipe is very easy to follow and very easy to make.
I've made these as nuggets before but decided to try as strips! Everyone gave a big thumbs up!
Awesome recipe!! My son saw this recipe on YouTube and wanted to try it. It was a family hit.

Best easy-to-use recipe
Thank you so much

I've made these 3 times now, the first time exactly as it is written here. My family loved them and they were devoured almost as soon as they were done. But I am keeping a close eye on our fat intake so the second time I baked them. Good, but there was quite a bit of flour remaining on each strip. It didn't affect the taste but since everyone eats with their eyes first, I knew I had to find a healthier, more eye-appealing way to serve these up. So, most recently I dredged each tender in the flour first, then moistened in the egg, and dredged with the flour again, and the excess shaken off. I cooked them in our air fryer and they were perfection. Homemade honey mustard on the side with a mixed green salad and it was one of our favorite, easy-to-do lunches.
So delicious! I made them into longer strips, but such a great tasting recipe!

Big hit. Both my husband and my kids bbn liked them. Wasn't sure if they were cooked all the thru at first. But once they get to that nice brown toast color of chicken strips or nuggets they are usually done all the way thru.
I loved this recipe. I made using 2 breasts. Since I didn't have garlic salt, I used garlic powder, onion powder, and pink Himalayan salt. The chicken was so juicy and my 6 year old loved them!
Simple, delish, and perfect. I made these with the intent of using on a big green lettuce salad but we couldn’t stay out of them. Thanks for the recipe!
so yum yum omg

Delicious! Kids love chik fil a and I can finally come close myself. I’d agree as is this is too salty and I like salt. Suggest cutting out 1/2 tbsp or maybe more. Will have to experiment myself. I cut the pepper down to 1tbsp. Tried boneless skinless chicken thighs the second time but breast is more successful. Thighs have a lot of fat and it’s almost impossible to cut it all off. I used canola oil. The first time a lot of extra flour mixture ended up in the oil so it browned by the time I got the last batch in. Need to be careful to shake excess off as recipe states. Going from egg to flour to oil worked fine for me.

Made this recipe last week out of chicken tenderloins since that's all I had. followed the recipe and a few suggestions in the comments. i coated the chicken in flour first, then egg, then back into the flour before frying. I ran low on flour and added corn meal and WOWZA there were none left after dinner! great recipe, definitely adding to the old cook book
This was quite good though you DO NOT need four cups of flour to coat. I took a hunch and two cups was plenty with some left over. I also added paprika to the flour.

Omg - this was amazing, simple and the crispiest chicken I have ever made! I battered twice which I think helped, reduced the salt by half and added a handful of seasoned panko. Thank you for an amazing recipe!
Super easy to make, and tastes SO GOOD.

The 1st time going with the recipe was fantastic, everyone loved it. But this time i only had 4 tablespoons of garlic salt...

Very delicious recipe
Followed the recipe, kept it simple...they were awesome!

I just made this for my family and they all loved it. 

I used 2 cups of flour, 2 tablespoons of garlic salt, 1½ tablespoons of pepper and repeated the egg/flour step. 

I used seven boneless skinless chicken thighs and it was fabulous. 

Thanks so much!!!
I made this for my honey to eat on his way to Vegas with his buddies along with a couple of musubis (Japanese ball rice) and they loved it!!

My children wanted to try this recipe after seeing it featured on Evantube HD. They loved them! However, I did not have garlic salt, so added 3 of salt and 3 of garlic powder instead. Well worth the prep time and fun to have my kids help with. The coating worked great and turned out nice and golden and crispy. The inside was delicious and juicy. DEFINITELY the BEST EVER!
I use buttermilk instead of eggs and it was fabulous!!
These turned out amazing

This was okay. I had to double the salt and pepper for any flavor, and ended up using 6 eggs. I learned that without coating in flour, then egg, then flour, it won't get a crispy coating. All in all, it was okay.
Way too much flour, I doubled the eggs and added some milk to thin it out and it turned out pretty decent. I also cut the flour in half and added some salt as I only had garlic powder

I'm pretty sure I used about half the garlic salt and less flour. I estimated the amounts based on what looked right to me. They were a huge hit! I used our deep fryer and corn oil. My hubby said they beat KFC hands down!
it so good i love it
I used whole breast and halved them, then cut them into smaller pieces. This was delicious!
Replaced 1/2 cup of flour with gluten free bread crumbs. And split the garlic salt portion using garlic powder for half to cut down salt. It was awesome. Thanks for sharing.
best ever
This was a very good recipe. The kids all enjoyed it, even my daughter that doesn't usually like chicken nuggets. I did have a lot of the flour mixture left over.
These actually taste pretty good. Will make again.

Ill wind up tweaking it a little for personal preference, but it turned out really well. The whole family liked it. Go ahead and make it. Like others have pointed out, dip the chicken in flour first, then the egg, then back in the flour.
Good recipe. Kid friendly, easy to make and tasty! My son loved it because they were less salty than chick fil a nuggets he said. I used garlic powder in stead of garlic salt and added salt to taste.
My family has renamed this recipe to Chicken crack. Its so good its addictive! Very simple to make and perfect directions too. 10 stars!

I will probably make it again, my family loved it. I used 3 tablespoons garlic powder and 1/2 tablespoon onion powder, along with 2 tablespoons salt and pepper. I made homemade honey mustard with it also. I used 3 chicken breasts and 2 cups of flour, and dipped the chicken in the flour, egg, then flour again. It served 5 people, going back for seconds.
We love these! My daughter says they are better than fast food!

Was looking for a chicken nugget recipe. As always, read the reviews before making. Just two of us, so cut up 2 very large chicken breasts and cut the flour mixture in half. Used 3 TBS of garlic powder, black pepper, several grinds of sea salt, and probably 1/4 tsp of cayenne pepper. Did the flour - egg- flour dip per other reviews and let it sit for 20 minutes. Deep fryer at 375 for 5-6 minutes and it was outstanding!! 

Wife found them pretty zippy from the cayenne, and I could taste the garlic powder.

No doubt will make again. Loved the breading.... nice and crispy.
So good!! This is the best nugget recipe I've ever used. We love it and its so easy to make.
My family loved it.
These chicken nuggets are amaZing!! I only used about 2 1/2 cups of flour and a little bit of garlic salt and a pepper. After all they were great!!
Instead of drowning my nuggets I only put half the oil . And used half the salt . And was very very delicious ! Telling everyone about this recipe A+

I have used this recipe for nuggets, strips and whole chicken breasts and have never been disappointed! You know its a real winner when your grandkids (ages 4&2)request "nanas nuggets" when they come to visit!
Excellent. I fry them in Peanut Oil though. Higher smoke point. Only good if you are not allergic though. Thank you!
I followed the recipe exactly and they came out absolutely delicious. My daughter LOVES these. Thank you for sharing Nichole.
These were very tasty. Would make them again. I used the sauce from a Bang Bang Shrimp recipe for a dipping sauce. Just delicious!
Loved it! Was simple and tastes yummy! I took the advise someone posted and used 3 cups of flour and 1 cup bread crumbs. Made a great batter!

I made this recipe as a snack for my kids today. My son, Garett, did all the egg work and my daughter, AnnaBelle, did all the flour and seasonings. They absolutely LOVED the process and said that the nuggets were better than Chick-Fil-A...and that's saying a lot! I used a FryDaddy instead of a pot and they still turned out great! Amazing flavor! Thanks for sharing!

The second time I made this I cut the egg, flour, garlic salt and pepper in half and still had a small amount left over after coating the chicken. I cooked the chicken in 2 tablespoons of oil (per 1 lb. of chicken)...which was just enough to cut down on the fat but keep the chicken from drying out. This is my go to recipe now for chicken nuggets. It's so easy and I always have the ingredients on hand.

Seriously delicious! Definitely lives up to the name. I halved the recipe and I shouldn't have.....my family wanted me to get back in the kitchen immediately and make more. Make this recipe, you will not regret it!
Awesome loved them only problem was there wasn't really enough side seasoning had to add but the recipe itself is still 4-5 star!
Lessened the garlic salt by half and added onion powder. Kids LOVED!
So simple but so delicious!! Great recipe to get the kids involved!

Made this tonight for dinner. Both children and wife loved it. Mistaken for KFC nuggets. I did use less garlic salt. Added some season all. And I also did the flour egg then flour again. Still the texture was not as heavy as you may imagine. Perfect!! Will make again very soon!
Used beer instead of water for the batter. Crispy, light and tasty. Yes please
Kind of bland. Try adding some different spices. THis recipe easily translated to gluten free, just replaced the regular flour with some rice flour.
Marinade in pickle juice to actually get th real chic fila tatse

I have made these about 4 or 5 times now...
Thank you for the step by step instructions. I followed another reviewer's advice, and dipped them first in flour, then egg, then flour again. I also used seasoning salt instead of all the garlic.
My family loves these!
Outstanding! easy to make, kids love them. Cut all ingredients by a third except for the chicken. Will definitely make again.
wonderful tasted great did not have garlic salt so used garlic pepper plus a little bit of salt
Wonderfully easy and very tasty.
I cooked a quarter portion, so I reduced the ingredients to one quarter. I also added about a tablespoonful of paprika powder, as I like my food spicy, and it turned out great! Thanks!

I made this recipe as is and I made a batch using salt (to taste) in place of half the garlic salt because my husband and kids don't care for garlic much. But, they all preferred this recipe exactly as written with the full amount of garlic salt. It's a keeper. Thanks
Great recipe for the children.

I used about 2.5 cups of flour, for I only used 2 large boneless breasts.. I didn't use too much garlic salt, though I used McCormick's garlic seasoning for grilling that my picky son likes. Came out great, nice and crunchy and reminds me of popcorn chicken. :)
It was really delicious and simple!! Real good
